gram1_ar_1.title: Difference between "a" and "an" in English – Grammar from Movies, Full Course
gram1_ar_1.description: Know when to use "a" or "an" based on the sound of the next word, not its first letter.

gram1_ar_2.title: Difference between "this" and "that" in English – Grammar from Movies
gram1_ar_2.description: Distinguish "this" (near) from "that" (far) to point things out accurately while speaking.

gram1_ar_3.title: Difference between "these" and "those" in English – Grammar from Movies for Beginners
gram1_ar_3.description: Use "these" for near plural items and "those" for distant ones without confusion.

gram1_ar_4.title: Auxiliary (Helping) Verbs in English – Grammar from Movies for Beginners
gram1_ar_4.description: Master am/is/are/was/were to build correct sentences in every tense.

gram1_ar_5.title: Forming Questions in English – Grammar from Movies for Beginners
gram1_ar_5.description: Invert word order or use Do/Does to form yes/no questions correctly.

gram1_ar_6.title: Wh- Questions in English – Grammar from Movies for Beginners
gram1_ar_6.description: Place a Wh-word at the start and invert the verb to ask about time, place or reason.

gram1_ar_7.title: Adjectives in English from Movies – Full Grammar Course Episode 7
gram1_ar_7.description: Put adjectives before nouns and learn how to compare and prefer easily.

gram1_ar_8.title: Countable vs Uncountable Nouns in English – Full Grammar from Movies 8
gram1_ar_8.description: Know when to add "s", use "few/little", and when the noun can’t be counted to make fewer mistakes.

gram1_ar_9.title: Plural Forms in English – Adding s, es, ies – Grammar from Movies
gram1_ar_9.description: Add "s", "es" or change "y" to "ies" to form regular plurals confidently.

gram1_ar_10.title: Many, Much, Little, a lot of, Some – Full Grammar Guide 10
gram1_ar_10.description: Use "many" with countable and "much" with uncountable nouns, plus other common quantifiers.

gram1_ar_11.title: Possessive Adjectives & Possessive Pronouns – Full Grammar 11
gram1_ar_11.description: Show ownership with "my/your" or with "’s" without mixing adjectives and pronouns.

gram1_ar_12.title: Object Pronouns in English – Grammar from Movies 12
gram1_ar_12.description: Use me/him/her instead of I/he/she when the pronoun is the object of the verb.

gram1_ar_13.title: Whose – Question Word for Ownership – Grammar from Movies
gram1_ar_13.description: Ask about the owner with "whose" instead of long "who is the owner of".

gram1_ar_14.title: Simple Present Tense – Grammar from Movies
gram1_ar_14.description: Use "I go / He goes" for habits and facts, and place negatives correctly.

gram1_ar_15.title: Simple Present Tense Quiz – 10 Quick Questions
gram1_ar_15.description: Review the simple present with 10 timed questions to check your mastery.

gram1_ar_16.title: Present Continuous Tense – Grammar from Movies 16
gram1_ar_16.description: Use am/is/are + ing for actions happening now or temporary situations.

gram1_ar_17.title: Do you vs Are you – When to Use Do or to be – Grammar Course 17
gram1_ar_17.description: Ask about verbs with "Do" and about states/descriptions with "Are" to sound natural.

gram1_ar_18.title: Simple Past Tense – Grammar from Movies 18
gram1_ar_18.description: Add "-ed" or use irregular verbs to talk about finished past moments.

gram1_ar_19.title: Past Continuous Tense – Grammar for Beginners 19
gram1_ar_19.description: Use was/were + ing to describe ongoing past actions or background events.

gram1_ar_20.title: Linkers: When vs While – Full Grammar 20
gram1_ar_20.description: Use "when" for a single moment and "while" for a longer ongoing action to order events logically.

gram1_ar_21.title: Simple Future: Will vs Going to – Full Grammar 21
gram1_ar_21.description: Use "will" for instant decisions and "going to" for pre-planned future actions.

gram1_ar_22.title: Comparative & Superlative Adjectives – Grammar 22
gram1_ar_22.description: Add "-er/-est" or use "more/most" to compare things with any adjective.

gram1_ar_23.title: Superlative Adjectives Made Easy – Full Grammar 23
gram1_ar_23.description: Focus on the top item only with "the tallest" to show the lead within a group.

gram1_ar_24.title: Grammar Wars & Fun Linguist Facts – Grammar 24
gram1_ar_24.description: Discover fun behind-the-scenes facts about English grammar to love the language even more.

before_maths_ar_1.title: Why Do We Even Study Math?
before_maths_ar_1.description: See how math sneaks into every corner of life and why it pays to understand it.

before_maths_ar_2.title: A World Without Math—What Would Change?
before_maths_ar_2.description: Imagine tomorrow if numbers disappeared and discover how much tech would vanish.

before_maths_ar_3.title: So… What Exactly Is Mathematics?
before_maths_ar_3.description: A plain-English tour of the subject's main branches and what each one does.

before_maths_ar_4.title: The Hidden History of the Word 'Math' & the Subject Itself
before_maths_ar_4.description: Learn where the word comes from (spoiler: not sports) and meet the ancient minds who started it all.

count1_ar_1.title: Number Systems Through Time
count1_ar_1.description: Travel back to see how early humans kept count before calculators.

count1_ar_2.title: The Unary System—One Mark, One Count
count1_ar_2.description: The simplest system ever: one notch for every item.

count1_ar_3.title: Sumerian Symbols—Writing Numbers in Clay
count1_ar_3.description: Meet cuneiform numerals pressed into tablets 5,000 years ago.

count1_ar_4.title: Babylonian Base-60—Yes, That's Where Time Comes From
count1_ar_4.description: See why we still have 60 seconds and 60 minutes today.

count1_ar_5.title: Egyptian Hieroglyphic Numbers
count1_ar_5.description: Decode the picture-numbers scribes used along the Nile.

count1_ar_6.title: Roman Numerals—Letters as Numbers
count1_ar_6.description: Master I, V, X, L, C, M and the simple rules that govern them.

count1_ar_7.title: Old Systems Side-by-Side
count1_ar_7.description: Quick compare-and-contrast to spot similarities and quirks.

count1_ar_8.title: Digits 1-9—Where Did Those Shapes Come From?
count1_ar_8.description: Watch the evolution of the figures you use every day.

count1_ar_9.title: Hindu-Arabic Numerals—The Birth of 0-9
count1_ar_9.description: Follow the journey from ancient India to global adoption.

calc1_ar_1.title: Counting—The Foundation
calc1_ar_1.description: Start at zero and build the number line step by step.

calc1_ar_2.title: Comparing Numbers
calc1_ar_2.description: Use >, < and = to order values like a pro.

calc1_ar_3.title: Ordering Numbers
calc1_ar_3.description: Arrange any list from smallest to largest (or vice-versa) in seconds.

calc1_ar_4.title: Zero—The Hero
calc1_ar_4.description: Discover why nothing can change everything in math.

calc1_ar_5.title: Addition Basics
calc1_ar_5.description: Master the plus sign with clear, visual examples.

calc1_ar_6.title: Addition—Carrying Tens
calc1_ar_6.description: Handle bigger numbers by carrying the one (or two).

calc1_ar_7.title: Addition—Practice Round
calc1_ar_7.description: Interactive drills to lock the skill in place.

calc1_ar_8.title: Subtraction—Take It Away
calc1_ar_8.description: Learn to subtract with no borrowing first.

calc1_ar_9.title: Subtraction—Borrowing From the Neighbor
calc1_ar_9.description: Cross out, borrow, and finish the problem cleanly.

calc1_ar_10.title: Subtraction—Big Numbers
calc1_ar_10.description: Apply the technique to multi-digit examples.

calc1_ar_12.title: Times Tables—1 to 10
calc1_ar_12.description: Memorize the grid that makes mental math lightning-fast.

calc1_ar_13.title: Multiplication—Single to Multi-Digit
calc1_ar_13.description: Scale up from 6 × 7 to 6 × 74 without breaking a sweat.

calc1_ar_14.title: Multiplication—Final Drills
calc1_ar_14.description: Lock it in with real-world word problems.

calc1_ar_15.title: Division—Sharing Equally
calc1_ar_15.description: Split amounts fairly and see the opposite of multiplication.

calc1_ar_16.title: Division—With Remainders
calc1_ar_16.description: Handle the leftovers and write them the right way.

calc1_ar_18.title: Division—Mixed Practice
calc1_ar_18.description: Test your skills with a variety of challenge questions.

calc1_ar_19.title: Four-Operation Mega Example
calc1_ar_19.description: Use add, subtract, multiply and divide in one real-life problem.

frac1_ar_1.title: Fractions—The Big Picture
frac1_ar_1.description: See why we chop things into parts and how it helps everyday life.

frac1_ar_2.title: Part of a Whole—The Core Idea
frac1_ar_2.description: Visualize slices of pizza, pies and shapes to nail the concept.

frac1_ar_3.title: Fractions on the Number Line
frac1_ar_3.description: Plot and compare fractions the same way you do whole numbers.

frac1_ar_4.title: Mixed & Improper Fractions on the Line
frac1_ar_4.description: Place 1 ¾ or 7⁄4 accurately and compare them in seconds.

frac1_ar_5.title: Types of Fractions—Proper, Improper, Mixed & Decimal
frac1_ar_5.description: One quick rundown that keeps them all straight.

frac1_ar_6.title: Converting Fractions to Decimals
frac1_ar_6.description: Turn 3⁄8 into 0.375 with a simple division trick.

frac1_ar_7.title: Decimal Conversion—Worked Examples
frac1_ar_7.description: Practice the trick on real fractions you'll actually meet.

frac1_ar_8.title: Decimal Conversion—Extra Practice
frac1_ar_8.description: Lock the skill in with a few more quick drills.

calc2_ar_1.title: Calculus – A One-Minute Road-map
calc2_ar_1.description: See why derivatives and integrals matter and where the course is headed—in 60 seconds.

calc2_ar_2.title: Calculus – Number Properties Quick Review 1
calc2_ar_2.description: Brush up on the basic rules you’ll need before you start differentiating anything.

calc2_ar_3.title: Calculus – Number Properties Quick Review 2
calc2_ar_3.description: Finish your crash refresher on exponents, roots and the order of operations.

calc2_ar_4.title: Calculus – Number Properties Practice
calc2_ar_4.description: Test yourself with a few quick warm-ups to make sure the basics are solid.

calc2_ar_5.title: Calculus – Types of Numbers in One Shot
calc2_ar_5.description: Learn to spot natural, integer, rational and real numbers at a glance.

func1_ar_1.title: Functions 1 – The Big Picture
func1_ar_1.description: Kick off the functions saga: what they are, why we care, and how to read the notation.

func1_ar_2.title: Functions 2 – Inputs, Outputs & Machines
func1_ar_2.description: Keep going: domain, range and the idea of a function as a machine.

func1_ar_3.title: Functions 3 – Graphs & Visual Checks
func1_ar_3.description: Move from algebra to pictures: plotting and the vertical-line test.

func1_ar_4.title: Functions – Worked Example
func1_ar_4.description: Walk through a complete example that ties the ideas together.

func1_ar_5.title: Composing Functions
func1_ar_5.description: Learn to chain functions together and find the new rule for f(g(x)).

func1_ar_6.title: Representing Functions (Tables, Arrow Maps, Formulas)
func1_ar_6.description: See every common way a function can be described and when to use each.

func1_ar_7.title: Formal Definition of a Function
func1_ar_7.description: Meet the set-theory definition and the notation that keeps everything precise.

func1_ar_8.title: The Number Line
func1_ar_8.description: Plot numbers, intervals and inequalities on a one-dimensional axis.

func1_ar_9.title: Cartesian Coordinates
func1_ar_9.description: Jump to 2-D: axes, quadrants and how every point gets an (x, y) address.

func1_ar_10.title: Linear Functions
func1_ar_10.description: Straight lines in slope-intercept form and how to graph them in seconds.

func1_ar_11.title: Linear Functions 2 – Point–Slope & Standard Forms
func1_ar_11.description: Expand your toolkit: more ways to write and use linear equations.

func1_ar_12.title: Non-Linear Functions 1 – Quadratics & Parabolas
func1_ar_12.description: Leave straight lines behind and explore curves.

func1_ar_13.title: Non-Linear Functions 2 – Cubics & Higher Powers
func1_ar_13.description: Keep going: cubic, quartic and general polynomial behaviour.

limit1_ar_1.title: Limits – A Friendly Intro 1
limit1_ar_1.description: Meet the central idea of calculus: what a limit is and why we need it.

limit1_ar_2.title: Limits – A Friendly Intro 2
limit1_ar_2.description: See how limits let us describe instantaneous speed and tangent slopes.

limit1_ar_3.title: Limits – Formal Definition (ε-δ) Part 1
limit1_ar_3.description: Learn the precise definition that underpins every limit proof.

limit1_ar_4.title: Limits – Formal Definition Part 2
limit1_ar_4.description: Practise reading and writing epsilon-delta statements.

limit1_ar_5.title: Limits – Basic Examples
limit1_ar_5.description: Apply the definition to simple polynomials and roots.

limit1_ar_6.title: Limits – More Worked Examples
limit1_ar_6.description: Tackle rational and piece-wise functions step by step.

limit1_ar_7.title: Limits – One-Sided Limits
limit1_ar_7.description: Distinguish left-hand and right-hand limits and when they matter.

limit1_ar_8.title: Limits – One-Sided Examples
limit1_ar_8.description: Practise cases where the two sides disagree or one is missing.

limit1_ar_9.title: Limits at Infinity (Symbolic)
limit1_ar_9.description: Explore what happens when x grows without bound.

limit1_ar_10.title: Limit Laws – Theory 1
limit1_ar_10.description: Sum, difference, product and quotient rules that make life easy.

limit1_ar_11.title: Limit Laws – Theory 2
limit1_ar_11.description: Power and root rules plus how to combine them.

limit1_ar_12.title: Limit Laws – Theory 3
limit1_ar_12.description: Composition (chain) rule and special trig limits.

limit1_ar_13.title: Limit Laws – Theory 4
limit1_ar_13.description: Squeeze theorem and two important special limits.

limit1_ar_14.title: Limit Laws – Worked Examples
limit1_ar_14.description: Put all the laws together in concrete calculations.

cont1_ar_1.title: Continuity – Intuition & Definition
cont1_ar_1.description: See what a continuous graph looks like and meet the three-part test.

cont1_ar_2.title: Continuity at a Point
cont1_ar_2.description: Check continuity step by step at a single x-value.

cont1_ar_3.title: Continuity & Complex Functions
cont1_ar_3.description: Extend the idea to the complex plane and what changes.

cont1_ar_4.title: Continuity on an Interval
cont1_ar_4.description: Move from one point to an entire interval and what extra care is needed at endpoints.

cont1_ar_5.title: nth Roots & Radicals
cont1_ar_5.description: Review roots as continuous functions and where they misbehave.

cont1_ar_6.title: Monic Polynomials (Degree-One Factors)
cont1_ar_6.description: See how linear factors affect continuity and sign changes.

cont1_ar_7.title: Odd vs Even Polynomials
cont1_ar_7.description: Compare symmetry and continuity behaviour of odd and even degrees.

cont1_ar_8.title: Even Polynomials Bounded Below
cont1_ar_8.description: Discover why even-degree polynomials with positive leading coefficient have a global minimum.

cont1_ar_9.title: Irrational Numbers & Continuity
cont1_ar_9.description: Investigate where irrational values break or preserve continuity.

cont1_ar_10.title: Least Upper Bound (Supremum) 1
cont1_ar_10.description: Meet the completeness axiom and why every bounded set has a sup.

cont1_ar_11.title: Least Upper Bound 2 – Existence & Uniqueness
cont1_ar_11.description: Prove the supremum exists and is unique.

cont1_ar_12.title: Least Upper Bound 3 – Applications to Continuity
cont1_ar_12.description: Use the sup to prove the Intermediate Value Theorem.

cont1_ar_13.title: Errata: Video 23 Correction
cont1_ar_13.description: Quick fix for an example in the previous lecture.

cont1_ar_14.title: Foundation Check-Point
cont1_ar_14.description: Quick quiz to make sure the continuity groundwork is solid before moving on.

deriv1_ar_1.title: Slope of the Tangent Line
deriv1_ar_1.description: Turn secant lines into a tangent and discover the need for a derivative.

deriv1_ar_2.title: Derivative vs Limit (The Key Link)
deriv1_ar_2.description: See how the derivative is nothing more than a special limit.

deriv1_ar_3.title: Basic Derivative Examples
deriv1_ar_3.description: Apply the definition to polynomials and simple roots.

deriv1_ar_4.title: Non-Differentiable at a Point
deriv1_ar_4.description: Identify corners, cusps and vertical tangents where the derivative fails.

deriv1_ar_5.title: Non-Differentiable Functions
deriv1_ar_5.description: Study functions that are nowhere differentiable and what their graphs look like.

deriv1_ar_6.title: When the Derivative Is Zero
deriv1_ar_6.description: Find stationary points and what they tell us about the shape of the graph.

deriv1_ar_7.title: Derivative Rule 1 – Power Rule
deriv1_ar_7.description: Learn the fastest way to differentiate xⁿ.

deriv1_ar_9.title: Power of a Function (Chain Rule Preview)
deriv1_ar_9.description: Handle [g(x)]ⁿ and see the chain rule coming.

deriv1_ar_10.title: Binomial Powers & Generalised Power Rule
deriv1_ar_10.description: Extend the rule to any real exponent.

deriv1_ar_12.title: Chain Rule – Composition
deriv1_ar_12.description: Master the rule that lets you differentiate any layered function.

deriv1_ar_13.title: Maxima & Minima – Fermat’s Theorem
deriv1_ar_13.description: Find critical points and use the first derivative test.

deriv1_ar_14.title: Mean Value Theorem
deriv1_ar_14.description: Understand the theoretical backbone that links average and instantaneous rate of change.

deriv1_ar_15.title: More Extrema Examples
deriv1_ar_15.description: Practice optimisation problems using the derivative tests.

deriv1_ar_16.title: Extended Mean Value Theorem (Cauchy Form)
deriv1_ar_16.description: Generalise the MVT to two functions and see why L’Hôpital works.

deriv1_ar_17.title: L’Hôpital’s Rule 1 – 0/0 Case
deriv1_ar_17.description: Evaluate indeterminate limits by differentiating numerator and denominator.

deriv1_ar_19.title: L’Hôpital’s Rule – Errata & Fine Print
deriv1_ar_19.description: Clear up a common mistake and state the precise conditions for the rule.

deriv1_ar_20.title: Inverse Functions 1 – Existence & Differentiation
deriv1_ar_20.description: Derive the derivative of an inverse function and see when it exists.

deriv1_ar_21.title: Inverse Functions 2 – Log and Inverse-Trig Examples

book_ar_1.title: Eat That Frog!
book_ar_1.description: Stop hitting snooze on your dreams. Swallow the ugliest 'frog' (your hardest task) first thing in the morning and cruise through the rest of your day like a boss. (Starter Gift)

book_ar_2.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
book_ar_2.description: Stop sweating the small stuff. Learn how to save your limited 'f*cks' for the things that actually matter and ignore the rest. (Starter Gift)

book_ar_3.title: You Are a Badass
book_ar_3.description: Forget imposter syndrome. This is your wake-up call to stop doubting your greatness and start living the awesome life you deserve. (Starter Gift)

book_ar_4.title: Atomic Habits
book_ar_4.description: You don't need a miracle, you need a system. Get 1% better every day and watch those tiny gains compound into massive results after a year. (Challenge Start)

book_ar_5.title: The Power of Habit
book_ar_5.description: Hack your brain's source code. Understand the 'loop' inside your head to break bad habits and build the ones that actually stick.

book_ar_6.title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
book_ar_6.description: Stop trading time for money. Learn the mindset shift that separates the wealthy from the working class. It's not about what you earn, it's about what you keep.

book_ar_7.title: The Total Money Makeover
book_ar_7.description: Ditch the debt and stop keeping up with the Joneses. Live like no one else today so you can live (and give) like no one else later.

book_ar_8.title: I Will Teach You to Be Rich
book_ar_8.description: Buy the latte. Seriously. Automate your finances, invest without stress, and live your 'Rich Life' guilt-free without cutting out the fun stuff.

book_ar_9.title: Your Money or Your Life
book_ar_9.description: Your time is the only real currency. Stop selling your soul for a paycheck just to buy junk you don't need to impress people you don't like.

book_ar_10.title: The ONE Thing
book_ar_10.description: If you chase two rabbits, you won't catch either. Laser-focus on the ONE thing that makes everything else easier or unnecessary.

book_ar_11.title: Essentialism
book_ar_11.description: The disciplined pursuit of less. Master the art of the polite 'No' to clear the clutter and reclaim your time for the truly epic opportunities.

book_ar_12.title: Deep Work
book_ar_12.description: In a world of TikTok and endless notifications, focus is a superpower. Learn to work with laser intensity while everyone else is scrolling.

book_ar_13.title: The Productivity Project
book_ar_13.description: This guy was a human guinea pig for productivity so you don't have to be. Get the hacks that actually work to get more done without the burnout.

book_ar_14.title: Getting Things Done (GTD)
book_ar_14.description: Your brain is for having ideas, not holding them. Dump the mental clutter into a smart system and achieve 'Mind Like Water'.

book_ar_15.title: The Magic of Thinking Big
book_ar_15.description: It costs nothing to dream big. Supersize your confidence and vision, and watch the universe open doors you didn't even know existed.

book_ar_16.title: Mindset
book_ar_16.description: Talent is overrated. Switch from 'I can't' to 'I can't YET' and unlock the growth mindset that champions use to dominate.

book_ar_17.title: Grit
book_ar_17.description: It’s a marathon, not a sprint. Discover why passion plus perseverance beats raw talent every single time in the long run.

book_ar_18.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective Teens
book_ar_18.description: The ultimate survival guide for growing up. Build a solid foundation now so you don't have to fix yourself later. Adulting made easier.

book_ar_19.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
book_ar_19.description: The OG success manual. Master these timeless principles to win at life and business without being a jerk.

book_ar_20.title: Think and Grow Rich
book_ar_20.description: The classic that started it all. Visualize your success, believe it, and hustle until your bank account matches your dreams.

book_ar_21.title: Contagious
book_ar_21.description: Why do some things go viral while others flop? Crack the code of social transmission and make your ideas stick like superglue.

book_ar_22.title: Influence: The Psychology of Persuasion
book_ar_22.description: The Jedi mind tricks of marketing. Learn the psychology behind why people say 'Yes' and use it ethically to persuade anyone.

book_ar_23.title: Jab, Jab, Jab, Right Hook
book_ar_23.description: Give, give, give, THEN ask. Stop spamming people and start building relationships. It's about providing value before throwing the 'Right Hook' for the sale.

book_ar_24.title: DotCom Secrets
book_ar_24.description: The playbook for internet domination. Learn how to build funnels that turn total strangers into raving fans (and repeat buyers).

book_ar_25.title: The Lean Startup
book_ar_25.description: Fail fast, fail cheap. Don't build a spaceship when a skateboard will do. Validate your idea before you blow your budget on a product nobody wants.

book_ar_26.title: Measure What Matters
book_ar_26.description: How Google took over the world. Ditch fuzzy goals for OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) and crush ambitious targets like the tech giants.

book_ar_27.title: Blue Ocean Strategy
book_ar_27.description: Stop fighting sharks in bloody waters. Sail to the blue ocean where there’s no competition and the profits are all yours to take.

book_ar_28.title: The Hard Thing About Hard Things
book_ar_28.description: No sugar-coating here. The brutal truth about running a startup when everything is on fire and you want to curl up under your desk. Real CEOs only.

book_ar_29.title: The Intelligent Investor
book_ar_29.description: The stock market bible. Ignore the hype, play the long game, and build real wealth without having a heart attack. (Final Book)

texts.pop-start-des-1: Massary's coding path is built on logic. Before syntax, our 'Pre-Programming' course builds your mindset. Learn how to think like a dev, analyze problems, and master the basics. Then, jump into Front-End with clarity. Solid base = Better results. We don't just teach code; we build professional minds.
texts.popUp-start-des-2: Our English track follows the 'ZAmerican English' method, optimized for Massary. No more confusion—just a clear, step-by-step journey to fluency. Every lesson builds on the last. Goal: Clear order → Constant growth → Real fluency. Massary makes learning easier.
texts.popUp-start-des-3: Math in Massary is about 'Understanding' not fear. Start with 'Math Basics' to build interest and logic. You'll see how concepts connect and tackle problems without stress. Once your mindset is ready, the formulas become easy. Simple: Right mindset → Deep grasp → Steady progress.
texts.popUp-not-done: Don't rush. Give yourself a chance to fully grasp the lesson. Small steps lead to massive progress.
texts.popUp-not-done-2: — Mr. Zaytouna 🌿 Small steps.. Real growth.

texts.about-us-story:
I was once an ordinary young man with ambition and dreams,
but the truth is — life wasn’t easy.
Paid courses? They were never an option.
So I learned from free resources, step by step,
without a clear path… every day something new, every day a different direction.

I got confused many times, wasted time,
but I never gave up.
With time, things started to make sense,
and the picture slowly became clearer.
That’s when a very simple question came to my mind:
Why should anyone else go through this struggle alone?

That question is what created Massary.

Massary is not built for money,
and it doesn’t rely on stolen content.
It’s simply an attempt to gather the best free resources,
organize them in a clear way,
and walk with you step by step instead of letting you go in circles.

There’s motivation, books, videos,
and a simple system of Zaitounas 🌿
to remind you that you’re making progress — even if it’s a small step.

Your support for Massary isn’t support for an app,
it’s support for young people like you,
so they don’t have to start from zero…
or waste their time in the same confusion we once lived through.
texts.support:
Your support is more than just a donation 🤍

Your support helps keep Massary 100% free
and allows us to continue supporting
thousands of young people
who want to learn, grow,
and find a clearer path forward.

Every contribution, no matter how small,
can open a real opportunity for someone else 🌱
texts.money-des:
Choose the amount that feels right for you,
and see it as a step that helps
keep knowledge accessible and opportunities open.

There is no such thing as a small contribution.
Every step you take makes an impact 🌿
start-page: The brain doesn’t confuse slow learning with failure — it clearly recognizes the difference between continuing and stopping.
Most feelings of "not making progress" happen because the change is internal and hasn’t surfaced yet.
Focus is a limited resource, not a personality trait — managing it matters more than increasing it.
Habits are not built by willpower, but by reducing daily decisions.
The brain learns faster when it feels safe, not under constant pressure.
Long interruptions are more harmful to learning than slow progress.
The brain prefers clarity over perfection — that’s why a clear step beats a perfect plan.
Most people quit the path just before real improvement begins.
Spaced learning is stored in long-term memory better than long, intense sessions.
Boredom is often a sign that your brain is adapting, not rejecting the task.
The brain physically changes through repetition, even if you feel no difference at first.
Reducing distractions is easier — and more powerful — than trying to increase discipline.
Quiet, consistent progress defeats fast but scattered bursts.
Deep understanding requires intentional slowness, not speed.
The mind doesn’t build a new pathway unless you walk it more than once.
Learning without application creates the illusion of progress.
The brain trusts small repeated actions more than big promises.
Feeling heavy before starting is normal — and often disappears after the first minute.
Your environment can destroy the best intentions without you noticing.
Habits don’t change your day — they change your direction.
Lack of motivation doesn’t mean lack of readiness.
The brain remembers beginnings and endings more than the middle — that’s why starting matters.
Consistency is built on ease, not harshness.
Feeling lost is often a transition phase, not a sign of failure.
Real learning changes how you think before it changes your results.
A conscious pause is better than exhausted persistence.
The mind dislikes "start over" but responds well to "continue from where you stopped."
Breaking a goal into parts reduces the brain’s resistance to it.
Feeling late doesn’t mean you actually are.
Most real change happens quietly, long before it’s noticed.

first-1.title: Welcome
first-1.content:
Hi, I’m Mr. Zaitouna

Your friend inside the Massary app
and your companion on the journey of learning and growth, step by step.

first-2.title: What is Massary?
first-2.content:
Massary carefully collects
the best free educational courses
and presents them to you as
organized – clear – enjoyable learning paths

Along with helpful resources
that allow you to apply and truly benefit.

first-3.title: Massary is more than courses
first-3.content:
Beyond learning paths, you’ll find:

📚 Massary Library
Powerful books summarized simply
without academic complexity

📺 Massary TV
Purposeful content carefully filtered from YouTube

🌱 Dream Garden
Reminds you of your dreams every day
so you never forget why you started.

first-4.title: Most importantly…
first-4.content:
Everything you’ve seen here

100% Free

No subscriptions
No pressure
No ads.
